newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan offers 100 million dinars of CDs.
newsitem.headline: Jordan offers 100 million dinars of CDs.

text.p: Jordan's Central Bank announced on Monday it was offering certificates of deposits (CDs) worth 100 million dinars ($141 million) at its next bi-monthly auction on Wednesday.
The bank said the offer was split equally between three-month and six-month paper. In a new ruling, it also limited individual banks to a maximum 40 percent of the CD issue.

The Central Bank introduced early this month for the first time a market-dictated CD auction system and began announcing yields in line with supply and demand as part of moves to adopt a move flexible interest rates structure.
Previously interest rates on three-month paper had been fixed for over a year at 9.25 percent and for six-month paper at 9.50 percent.
The Central Bank keeps a high interest rate policy to make dinar-denominated assets attractive and prevent a flow of dinars into dollar-denominated assets.
